name: Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
○ using the correct and complete set of drawings
○ all drawings are the latest revision.
Reference Documents - Drawings and Aconex Register
Record of conformity - Up to date drawing sets & ITP
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: CEMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents - CEMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Record of conformity - Site and Office Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation Permit issued by APAM obtained prior to any excavation on site.
Record of conformity - Proof of signed permit
Frequency - Prior to commencem ent of works
Acceptance Criteria - Drainage pipes supplied in accordance with AS4058. Material submission approval.
Frequency - Prior to commencem ent of works
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe to sit on firm foundation with pipe support cradles. Material submission/ Shop drawing submission.
Frequency - Prior to commencem ent of works
Acceptance Criteria - Encasement Material to be 5Mpa lean mix concrete for all RCP’s. Material submission approval.
Reference Documents - Cl16.5.6.1 & 16.6.2.2 & Tender Clarificatio ns #36
Frequency - Prior to commencem ent of works
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill material to be 6% cement stabilised sand to pavement formation level. Material submission approval.
Acceptance Criteria - Drainage pipes supplied and delivered as per approved Material submission. Manufacturer’s conformance report.
Record of conformity - Order Acceptance Form
Frequency - Prior to construction and each lot
Acceptance Criteria - Set out the stormwater drainage as shown on the Drawings to identify the locations, lengths and levels at outlets and inlets of pipes. This constitutes a Hold Point.
Acceptance Criteria - All excavation to be performed to the minimum depths, widths and batter slopes as shown on the Drawings, regardless of the type of material.
○ Trench excavation is to commence at the downstream end, where practical.

○ The width of trench to be such that the horizontal clearance from the outside of the pipe to wall of the trench to be minimum 300mm when under the runway and taxiway graded strip. Trench width outside of the runway and taxiway graded strip to be the greater of 150mm and D/6.
○ Subgrade Inspection to constitute a Hold Point.
Acceptance Criteria - Excavations are to be kept free from water during construction and backfilling and provide pumps, well-points or other equipment as necessary.
○ Any temporary works to be designed such that flooding upstream of the diversion does not occur. This constitutes a Hold Point.
Acceptance Criteria - 1 x DCP test to be undertaken per drainage line to confirm ground conditions.
○ Contractor to notify the Contract Administrator of any area of the foundation which contains material that is inadequate to support the proposed drainage structure.
○ Inadequate material is deemed to have a bearing pressure less than 130kPa, equivalent to 4 DCP blows per 100mm, per note 4 on drawing ZULU-BECA-012-DWG-07102.

○ Inadequate foundation material is to be replaced with a layer of coarse crushed aggregate compacted to 95% relative standard compaction to AS1289 Section 5.5.1 over a geotextile Bidim A29 or approved equivalent.
Reference Documents - Cl16.8.2 & Tender Clarificatio n 179
Record of conformity - DCP, Test Results
Acceptance Criteria - Bedding material/ subgrade to be prepared for laying the pipes. Pipe support cradles to be placed on firm bedding. This constitutes a Witness Point.

Acceptance Criteria - Initial sample 20m length of concrete pipeline to be laid and approved by the Contract Administrator for line and level before continuing construction of pipe network, Hold Point.
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete Pipes to be rigidly supported by approved steel pipe cradle during laying.
○ Pipes to be placed with spigot end facing downstream.
○ Pipes to be laid with the word ‘TOP’ and or lifting holes uppermost. Lifting holes to be plugged after installation.
○ All Concrete Pipes to be checked and subject to the approval of the Contract Administrator prior to commencement of backfilling, Hold Point.
Acceptance Criteria - The alignment, level and grade to be checked on the obvert of every third concrete pipe unit.
Invert levels at the upstream and downstream ends to be submitted to the Contract Administrator for review.
○ Maximum deviation from design invert level to not exceed 20mm and not result in zero grade or reversal of grade in any length of concrete pipe.
○ Where the design pipe grade is less than 1%, maximum deviation from pipe socket to pipe socket does not exceed 20 mm.
○ Maximum deviation from design invert level between upstream and downstream structures to not exceed 20mm and not result in zero grade or reversal of grade in any length of concrete pipe.
○ Maximum deviation of the concrete pipe from the alignment shown on the Drawings to not exceed 25mm.
Acceptance Criteria - RCP’s under Runway and Taxiway Graded Strip
○ 5MPa wet lean mix to 200mm above pipe obvert
○ 6% Cement Stabilised Sand to pavement formation level
RCP’s outside Runway and Taxiway Graded Strip
○ 5MPa wet lean mix 150mm above pipe overt completed in stages
○ Site won material completed in 200mm loose layer thickness (maximum) to pavement formation level or 6% stabilised sand
Reference Documents - Cl.16.5.6 & IFC Drawings & Tender Clarificatio n #164
Inspection/Test Method - Verify and Site Inspection
Record of conformity - Delivery Docket and ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete Backfill Under Runway and Taxiway Graded Strip
○ 1 compressive strength test for each 50m3 of backfill
○ Concrete Backfill Outside Runway and Taxiway Graded Strip
○ 1 compressive strength test for each 100m3 of backfill
○ Backfill Zone - Outside the Runway and Taxiway Graded Strip
○ Minimum RD of 95% SMDD (1 lot consists of every 50m3 for concrete backfill and every 2nd layer of backfill zone material.)
Acceptance Criteria - CCTV inspection of RCPs required at the completion of the works. Submission of CCTV footage to the Contract Administrator for review is a Hold Point.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
